result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey V Rupnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Sexual Assault], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact directly or indirectly with the victim, no contact at their residence/property

Expungement under 973.015 upon; payment of fines/costs, no further law violations for one year, successful completion of probation.  Request must be made in writing using form CR-266 to the Court and District Attorney.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Comply with Sex Offender Registration for 5 years only

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages
No contact directly or indirectly with victim by any means once on Extended Supervision - 3rd party contact to schedule visitation with children allowed 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription
No criminal conduct 
Not to possess body armor ever 
Not to enter a romantic relationship without agents approval
Not to gain or attempt to gain internet access using a computer, smartphone, or any electronic device with agents approval
Not to gain or attempt to gain access to any social media sites using a computer, smartphone, or any elctronic device without agents approval

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent
Provide DNA sample
Comply with Sex Offender Registration

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Conditions:
Expires 2-16-14.
During term of DCA, defendant shall commit no violation to level of probable cause.
If DCA not revoked during term, charge shall be dismissed.
No revocation may take place without hearing before Court and notice to all parties.
Defendant waives right to speedy trial.
Invent expiration date expires, nothing in DCA or laws of State shall prevent State from seeking revocation of DCA if State has filed motion to revoke prior to the expiration date.
Defendant shall notify Clerk of Court's Office within 72 hours of change of address.
Defendant shall comply with all probation rules and regulations of the supervision ordered in this case's other conviction(s).
Defendant agrees to have an AODA assessment performed w/60 days of the approval of this agreement. Defendant shall provide proof of such counseling.
Defendant shall be required to register and comply w/the Wisconsin Sexual Offender Registry as provided by statute.
Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact w/the victim at any time during the pendency of this agreement. 
Defendant shall participate and complete anger management counseling to be set up through his probation agent on the other charge.

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages
No contact directly or indirectly with victim by any means once on Extended Supervision - 3rd party contact to schedule visitation with children allowed 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription
No further criminal conduct 
Not to possess body armor ever 
Not to enter a romantic relationship without agents approval 
Not to gain or attempt to gain internet access using a computer, smartphone, or any electronic device without agents approval
Not to gain or attempt to gain access to any social media sites using a computer, smartphone, or any elctronic devices without agents approval

Provide DNA sample
Comply with Sex Offender Registration
